object.field:
The File Transfer Process is a highly regulated process by DIA and it is imperative that customers utilizing the Combined File Transfer Service understand their roles and responsibilities. Please ensure you have read the policies that govern the use of this service.
Information regarding the USBICES Cross Domain Centers is available in the Resource drop down.

Reliable Human Reviewer is a subject matter expert in your unit who reviewed your file prior to upload to CFTS and cannot be the requester. This is not a CFTS team member.
Provide your RHR's SIPR email address.

The file submitted for transfer contains CONFIDENTIAL classification markings and cannot be transferred to NIPR. Please correct the issues, have your SSO review and resubmit through CFTS.
The CENTCOM IM Transfer team cannot transfer files to the NIPRnet that contain classified markings anywhere in the file (i.e., PowerPoint Master Slides, Layout, Document Properties, etc.).
We also recommend that you utilize IC Clear to review your files prior to submitting them through CFTS for transfer: https://icclears01.oni.nmci.navy.smil.mil/Clear/
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.
RHR is the individual who reviewed your file prior to upload to CFTS and cannot be the requester.

We do not transfer test messages.
We are in the process of reviewing and moving files. The Combined File Transfer Service is not automated, it relies upon reliable human review. We do our best to ensure all transfers are completed within four hours of submission during our normal hours.
Our normal business hours are 0600-1700 EST Monday - Friday. On Saturday and Sunday our desk is manned 0700-1500 EST.
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.
CFTS File Rejected - File Not Marked

The file submitted for transfer to CPN- does not contain classification markings. Documents being transferred must be marked, please ensure file contains classification markings on each page/slide/sheet and resubmit through CFTS for transfer.
The IM team does not retain files that have been rejected.
CFTS Request Rejected Missing Markings page/slide/sheet

Documents being transferred from SIPR must be marked on each page/slide/sheet. Correct the issues and resubmit through CFTS for transfer.
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.
CFTS Transfer Request Rejected Missing Classification Markings

Every document that is on a classified network is required to have the appropriate classification markings per CAPCO guidance. It does not matter whether the documents contain information or not.
Classification in the file name is not sufficient.
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.

The file submitted for transfer to CPN- does not contain an appropriate tetragraph classification markings.
The IM team does not retain files that have been rejected.
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.

The file submitted for transfer contains SECRET classification markings and cannot be transferred to NIPR. Please correct the issues, have your SSO review and resubmit through CFTS.
The CENTCOM IM Transfer team cannot transfer files to the NIPRnet that contain classified markings anywhere in the file (i.e., PowerPoint Master Slides, Layout, Document Properties, etc.).
We also recommend that you utilize IC Clear to review your files prior to submitting them through CFTS for transfer: https://icclears01.oni.nmci.navy.smil.mil/Clear/
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.

Per DoD Regulation 5200 01 (pg 66 para (2); a redacted document requires a memo from the current Original Classification Authority (OCA) stating the document has been redacted and is authorized for the target network.
CFTS File Rejected - Over Size Limit
The file submitted for transfer exceeds the maximum size limit for transfer. There is a 10MB size limit for file transfers.

Due to several incidents of data compromise via NIPR, we are awaiting HQ USAF A-3 promulgate policy to subordinate USAF units regarding process and procedure to ensure OPSEC is not violated, placing our personnel, equipment, and mission at risk. Per our SSO we cannot transfer information with any future troop movement dates or past movement rosters that have locations on them, or ones with RLD, ALD, or RDD codes. USCENTCOM will not pass JOPES/DCAPES type data to include PRF and LVY files from SIPR to NIPR.
The issue is with RDD, RLD, ALD etc columns showing future force movement, according to CENTCOM classification guidance any indication of future movement makes this secret. We were recently told that in order for it to be UNCLASS it must be 21 days after these dates.
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
CFTS Transfer Request Rejected Missing Classification Markings

The files submitted for transfer to NIPR do not contain classification markings. Documents being transferred from SIPR to NIPR must be marked, please ensure each file contains classification markings on each page/slide/sheet and resubmit through CFTS for transfer.
Every document that is on a classified network is required to have the appropriate classification markings per CAPCO guidance. It does not matter whether the documents contain information or not.
Classification in the file name is not sufficient.
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
CFTS Request Rejected SECRET Markings in File

The files submitted for transfer contain SECRET classification markings and cannot be transferred to NIPR. Please correct the issues, have your SSO review and resubmit through CFTS.
The CENTCOM IM Transfer team cannot transfer files to the NIPRnet that contain classified markings anywhere in the file (i.e., PowerPoint Master Slides, Document Properties, etc.).
We also recommend that you utilize IC Clear to review your files prior to submitting them through CFTS for transfer: https://icclears01.oni.nmci.navy.smil.mil/Clear/
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide is available on the main page of CFTS.
CFTS Request Rejected -- Unable to Open File

The file submitted for transfer is not a format we are unable to open, and therefore cannot be transferred to NIPR. If there is a way you can convert this file to a format we are able to open such as .ppt, .xlsx, .doc or .pdf and the file contains proper classification markings we will transfer it.

Due to several incidents of data compromise, files with hidden data will not be transferred. Please ensure all data is readily visible for the review process.
Files with tracked changes, hidden data, hidden worksheets, hidden names, active filters or comments will not be transferred. Please ensure documents submitted for transfer do not contain any of these items.
As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service. Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
Please be aware that we have provided a file review guide under the
resources tab in the Combined File Transfer Service to assist in your RHR
process.

As a customer it is your responsibility to follow the policies that govern the use of this service.
Our policy and user guide are available on the main page of CFTS.
Continued failure to follow our policy will result in you to no longer be able to use our service.
